an6.99:1: "Truly, bhikkhus, () it is impossible that a bhikkhu who considers any conditioned phenomenon to be pleasurable will possess a conviction in conformitywith the teaching. (2) It is impossible that one who does not possess a conviction in conformitywith the teachingwill enter upon the fixed course of rightness. (3) It is impossible that one who does not enter upon the fixed course of rightness will realize the fruit of stream-entry, (4) the fruit of once-returning, (5) the fruit of non-returning, (6) or arahantship.
